title: [caffe2] Where can I get the API description of caffe2?
body_html:
Hello!
I am new to caffe2 and am trying to use caffe2 to build a network.
But I am struggling to the api. The official website didn't provide the description of api in detail.(Which just tell me to input X and it will output Y)
For example, if I want to use model.AvgPool in python, I dont know if global_pooling is supported and I try to find the api. However, I get to pool_op.cc and I didn't find any parameter of global_pooling, but I find a parameter "global_pooling" in base_conv_pool.
In caffe, I can read caffe.proto to know what parameter is used. So where can I get the api description of caffe2 op?
body_text:

For example, if I want to use model.AvgPool in python, I dont know if global_pooling is supported and I try to find the api. However, I get to pool_op.cc and I didn't find any parameter of global_pooling, but I find a parameter "global_pooling" in base_conv_pool.
In caffe, I can read caffe.proto to know what parameter is used. So where can I get the api description of caffe2 op?
body:
Hello! 
I am new to caffe2 and am trying to use caffe2 to build a network.
But I am struggling to the api. The official website didn't provide the description of api in detail.(Which just tell me to input X and it will output Y)
For example, if I want to use model.AvgPool in python, I dont know if global_pooling is supported and I try to find the api. However, I get to pool_op.cc and I didn't find any parameter of global_pooling, but I find a parameter "global_pooling" in base_conv_pool.
In caffe, I can read caffe.proto to know what parameter is used. So where can I get the api description of caffe2 op?
